sen.j: 森山 栄之助（もりやま えいのすけ、または森山多吉郎、文政3年6月1日 (旧暦)（1820年7月10日） - 明治4年（1871年））は、江戸時代に活躍した日本の通詞（通訳）。
sen.e: Einosuke MORIYAMA (also referred to as Takichiro MORIYAMA, July 10, 1820 - 1871) was a translator (interpreter) of Japan being active in Edo period.
Einosuke MORIYAMA (also referred to as Takichiro MORIYAMA, July 10, 1820 - 1871) was a Japanese interpreter in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 登録用語よりも翻訳者が括弧に入れたinterpreterの方が正しいので直します。
sen.e: Einosuke MORIYAMA (also referred to as Takichiro MORIYAMA, July 10, 1820 - 1871) was a Japanese interpreter in the Edo period.

sen.j: 文政3年（1820年）、長崎に生まれる。
sen.e: In 1820, born in Nagawaki Prefecture.
In 1820, he was born in Nagasaki (present Nagasaki Prefecture).
sen.cmt: スタイルを統一させます。
sen.e: In 1820, he was born in Nagasaki (present Nagasaki Prefecture).

sen.j: 家は代々オランダ通詞を務めていた。
sen.e: His family had been serving as Dutch translator for generations.
His family had been serving as Dutch interpreter for generations.
His family had been serving as Dutch interpreter for generations.

sen.j: 嘉永元年（1848年）、偽装漂着のアメリカ人ラナルド・マクドナルドから本格的に英語を学び、蘭・英2カ国語を使いこなせる通詞として活躍する。
sen.e: In 1848, he professionally learned English from Ranald MacDonald, an American disguised as castaway, and showed a great performance as interpreter using Dutch and English.

In 1848, he professionally learned English from Ranald MacDonald, an American who had entered Japan disguising himself as a castaway; he became an interpreter who could used Dutch and English perfectly and played very important role in those days.

In 1848, he professionally learned English from Ranald MacDonald, an American who had entered Japan disguising himself as a castaway; he became an interpreter who could used Dutch and English perfectly and played very important role in those days.

sen.j: 嘉永3年（1850年）には「エゲレス語和解」の編集に従事し、嘉永6年（1853年）のプチャーチン来航の際は川路聖謨の通詞として活躍する。
sen.e: In 1850, he engaged in editing of 'English explained in Japanese', and showed a great performance as Toshiakira KAWAJI's translator when Evfimiy Vasil'evich Putyatin visited Japan in 1853.

In 1850, he engaged in editing of 'English explained in Japanese', and showed a great performance as the interpreter for Toshiakira KAWAJI during the visit of Evfimiy Vasil'evich Putyatin to Japan in 1853.

In 1850, he engaged in editing of 'English explained in Japanese', and showed a great performance as the interpreter for Toshiakira KAWAJI during the visit of Evfimiy Vasil'evich Putyatin to Japan in 1853.

sen.j: また、オランダの地図に樺太の日露国境が北緯50度線となっていることを発見する。
sen.e: Also, he found out that border between Japan and Russia in Karafuto was situated at north latitude 50 on a Dutch map.
Also, he knew that on a Dutch map the border between Japan and Russia at Karafuto Island was situated at latitude fifty degrees north.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: Also, he knew that on a Dutch map the border between Japan and Russia at Karafuto Island was situated at latitude fifty degrees north.

sen.j: これが、日本の対露国境の根拠となる。
sen.e: This became an evidence for Japan to fix a border to Russia.
This became an evidence for Japan to fix a border to Russia.
This became an evidence for Japan to fix a border to Russia.

sen.j: 嘉永7年（1854年）のマシュー・ペリー来航の際も通訳を務め、その後江戸小石川に英語塾を開く。
sen.e: In 1854, he served again as interpreter when Matthew (Calbraith) PERRY visited Japan, and after that, he founded an English school at Koishikawa, Edo.
In 1854, during the visit of Matthew (Calbraith) PERRY to Japan, he served as an interpreter; after that, he founded an English school at Koishikawa, Edo.
sen.cmt: スタイルを統一させます。
sen.e: In 1854, during the visit of Matthew (Calbraith) PERRY to Japan, he served as an interpreter; after that, he founded an English school at Koishikawa, Edo.

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）には開港延期問題で渡欧した竹内保徳遣欧使節団の通訳としてオールコックと同船でイギリスに赴き、使節一行とロンドンで合流する。
sen.e: In 1862, he left for England with Alcock on the same board as interpreter attendant on the mission to Europe led by Yasunori TAKEUCHI who had been sent to manage the issue of postponed port opening, and joined the mission at London.

In 1862, he left for England by a ship which Alcock also took and joined a mission and served as interpreter; the mission was led by Yasunori TAKEUCHI and had been sent to Europe in order to settle the issue of the postponement of opening the port.

In 1862, he left for England by a ship which Alcock also took and joined a mission and served as interpreter; the mission was led by Yasunori TAKEUCHI and had been sent to Europe in order to settle the issue of the postponement of opening the port.

sen.j: その後、各国を回り帰国。
sen.e: After that, he visited each country and returned.
After that, he visited each country and returned.
After that, he visited each country and returned.

sen.j: 帰国後は通弁役頭取、外国奉行支配調役などを歴任すると共に、万延元年（1860年）の大統領への英文書の作成にも活躍する。
sen.e: After returning Japan, he successively assumed office as Chief Interpreter and Shihai Shirabe-eki (a position under Gaikoku Bugyo) of Gaikoku Bugyo (a commissioner of foreign affairs), and in 1860, he contributed to a creation of English documents addressed to President.

After returning to Japan, he successively held important posts as chief of interpreters and inspector of the administration of Gaikoku Bugyo (commissioners of foreign affairs), and in 1860, he was involved in drawing up English documents addressed to the President.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: After returning to Japan, he successively held important posts as chief of interpreters and inspector of the administration of Gaikoku Bugyo (commissioners of foreign affairs), and in 1860, he was involved in drawing up English documents addressed to the President.

sen.j: しかし、維新後は新政府に仕えることはなかった。
sen.e: However, he never served the New Government after Meiji Restoration.
However, he never served the New Government after Meiji Restoration.
However, he never served the New Government after Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: なお、彼の英語塾の門下生には津田仙、福地源一郎、沼間守一などがいる。
sen.e: As pupils of his English school, there were Sen TSUDA, Genjiro FUKUCHI, Morikazu NUMA and so on.
As pupils of his English school, there were Sen TSUDA, Genichiro FUKUCHI, Morikazu NUMA and so on.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞写し間違いがあります。
sen.e: As pupils of his English school, there were Sen TSUDA, Genichiro FUKUCHI, Morikazu NUMA and so on.

sen.j: また福澤諭吉も短期間ではあったが学んでいる。
sen.e: Yukichi FUKUZAWA was also a pupil although a short term.
Yukichi FUKUZAWA was also a pupil although a short term.
Yukichi FUKUZAWA was also a pupil although a short term.

sen.j: 墓所は東京都豊島区巣鴨の本妙寺 (豊島区)。
sen.e: His grave was located at Honmyo-ji Temple, Sugamo, Toshima Ward, Tokyo (Toshima Ward).
